body_html:
From cmake doc https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.4/command/find_library.html, CMake will use a -framework A, and a -F to link the framework to the target, however it is not.

I have tried separating caffe2::cuda from Caffe2_PUBLIC_CUDA_DEPENDENCY_LIBS, still not linking properly. Removing caffe2::cuda passes the build though.
body_text:
From cmake doc https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.4/command/find_library.html, CMake will use a -framework A, and a -F to link the framework to the target, however it is not.
I have tried separating caffe2::cuda from Caffe2_PUBLIC_CUDA_DEPENDENCY_LIBS, still not linking properly.  Removing  caffe2::cuda passes the build though.
body:
From cmake doc [https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.4/command/find_library.html](url), CMake will use a -framework A, and a -F<fullPath> to link the framework to the target, however it is not. 

I have tried separating caffe2::cuda from Caffe2_PUBLIC_CUDA_DEPENDENCY_LIBS, still not linking properly.  Removing  caffe2::cuda passes the build though.
